oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Gibbs McAdoo, December 1923. From Wikipedia: William Gibbs McAdoo, Jr. (October 31, 1863 – February 1, 1941) was an American lawyer and political leader who served as a U.S. Senator, United States Secretary of the Treasury and director of the United States Railroad Administration. His family moved to Knoxville, TN, in 1877.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Birthday party, 1911
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Seventy-eighth birthday, July 11, 1911. Amanda McTeer (Mrs. Joseph McTeer); Margaret McDermott (Mrs. Gus McDermott); Miss Isabella ('Bella') McNutt White. (Whose birthday is not known). Submitted ID: Amanda Morgan White McTeer - born 4 Sep 1844 Margaret Park White McDermott - born 1 Apr 1841 Isabella McNutt White - born 30 Jul 1833
In 1911, they were the three surviving children of George McNutt White and Sophia Moody Park. If it's one of them whose 78th birthday it was, it would have to be Isabella, though they would've been celebrating a couple weeks early.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Birthday parties; Families;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Knox County Two Centuries Photograph Project
